intro: Miconia richardsprucei, commonly known as the Richards spruce. It is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family, native to the humid lowland forests of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in panicle-like inflorescences. The plant is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
